snippet: A growing urbanized middle class wants politicians facing charges driven from the system, but tribal voters see some, like Kameshwar Baitha, as heroes.
abstract: New dynamics are rippling through Indian politics as a growing, urbanized middle class focuses on anticorruption message, demanding that hundreds of tainted politicians be driven from system; criminal records have become badge of honor for politicians in impoverished, low-caste areas, but Supreme Court has made ruling that would disqualify criminals from ballot; measure is gaining political support.

byline.contributor: Hari Kumar and Malavika Vyawahare contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: A growing urbanized middle class wants politicians facing charges driven from the system, but tribal voters see some, like Kameshwar Baitha, as heroes.

headline.main: In India’s Politics, Jail Time Is a Badge of Honor
headline.print_headline: In India’s Politics, Jail Time Is a Badge of Honor
